article_title: Report: Miami-Dade to face tough choices as federal funding for uninsured dwindles
article_text:
Federal funds for hospitals to treat uninsured will be reduced again

New rules restrict use of federal funds for charity care only

Report outlines challenges for uninsured in absence of Medicaid expansion

article_metadata.news-keywords: Florida, uninsured, Medicaid, Affordable Care Act, Obamacare, Rick Scott, Jackson Memorial Hospital, Jackson Health System, Low Income Pool
article_metadata.description: Florida legislators, meeting this month in Tallahassee, are looking down the barrel of a healthcare financial crisis for the second consecutive year — and once again, Miami-Dade, home to the state’s largest number of uninsured residents and its busiest public hospital, Jackson Health System, stands to lose more than any other county, according to a report released Wednesday.
article_metadata.title: Report: Miami-Dade to face tough choices as federal funding for uninsured dwindles | Miami Herald
